Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
gstk - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: GSTK Process
Screen.Label: Stack traces without requirement of sorting into stack gathers.
NTIM=
TVFSE=
TIM_BEG=
TIM_END=
OPT_MDT=
HDR_INL=
INL_INIT=
INL_INC=
INL_WID=
INL_LAST=
INL_TOT=
HDR_CRL=
CRL_INIT=
CRL_INC=
CRL_WID=
CRL_LAST=
CRL_TOT=
HDR_OFF=
OFF_INIT=
OFF_INC=
OFF_WID=
OFF_LAST=
OFF_TOT=

Help.Tip: Number of Traces In Memory.
Help.Text:
gstk - NTIM
Number of Traces In Memory.
 
 Default = 5000
 Allowed = int > 0
 Generally NTIM should be set large enough so that disk swapping is minimized,
 but small enough to avoid restrictions on memory availability or cost.
 
 For operation in conjunction with DMO, NTIM should be set to a minimum
 of the number of bins in a rectangular array that might be populated by a DMO
 broadcast operator for the largest offset.  Larger values may increase
 efficiency, but at some point limits on memory availability and memory cost
 will establish an upper limit on NTIM.

Help.Tip: Time Varying Fold of Stack Exponential stack scaling method.
Help.Text:
gstk - TVFSE
Time Varying Fold of Stack Exponential stack scaling method.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = 0.0-1.0
 The Time Varying Fold of Stack Exponential method scales stacked traces by
 dividing trace samples by the time varying number of live samples stacked
 together raised to the TVFSE power.  TVFSE = 0.0 does no scaling.  This is an
 industry-standard method.

Help.Tip: Starting time for the stacked traces.
Help.Text:
gstk - TIM_BEG
Starting time for the stacked traces.
 
 Default = TSTRT
 Allowed = real
 Stacked traces will be dead before TIM_BEG if TSTRT < TIM_BEG.

Help.Tip: Ending time for the stacked traces.
Help.Text:
gstk - TIM_END
Ending time for the stacked traces.
 
 Default = end of trace
 Allowed = real > TIM_BEG
 Stacked traces will be dead after TIM_END if TIM_END < end of trace.

Help.Tip: Option for handling Missing or Dead input Traces.
Help.Text:
gstk - OPT_MDT
Option for handling Missing or Dead input Traces.
 
 Default = DEL
 Allowed = DEL
 Allowed = FILL
 Allowed = KILL
 Output traces corresponding to missing or dead input traces are deleted
 (OPT_MDT = DEL), filled in (OPT_MDT = FILL) or killed (OPT_MDT = KILL).
 FILL option should be used only when GSTK is a part of a DMO or other
 migration process.

Help.Tip: Header word for inline coordinate.
Help.Text:
gstk - HDR_INL
Header word for inline coordinate.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_INL for center of first bin.
Help.Text:
gstk - INL_INIT
Value of HDR_INL for center of first bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment between bins in inline direction.
Help.Text:
gstk - INL_INC
Increment between bins in inline direction.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0

Help.Tip: Width of bins in inline direction.
Help.Text:
gstk - INL_WID
Width of bins in inline direction.
 
 Default = INL_INC
 Allowed = INL_INC >= real > 0.0

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_INL for center of last bin.
Help.Text:
gstk - INL_LAST
Value of HDR_INL for center of last bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real >= INL_INIT

Help.Tip: Total number of bins in inline direction.
Help.Text:
gstk - INL_TOT
Total number of bins in inline direction.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int > 0

Help.Tip: Header word for crossline coordinate.
Help.Text:
gstk - HDR_CRL
Header word for crossline coordinate.
 
 Default = 8
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_CRL for center of first bin.
Help.Text:
gstk - CRL_INIT
Value of HDR_CRL for center of first bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment between bins in crossline direction.
Help.Text:
gstk - CRL_INC
Increment between bins in crossline direction.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0

Help.Tip: Width of bins in crossline direction.
Help.Text:
gstk - CRL_WID
Width of bins in crossline direction.
 
 Default = CRL_INC
 Allowed = CRL_INC >= real > 0.0

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_CRL for center of last bin.
Help.Text:
gstk - CRL_LAST
Value of HDR_CRL for center of last bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real >= CRL_INIT

Help.Tip: Total number of bins in crossline direction.
Help.Text:
gstk - CRL_TOT
Total number of bins in crossline direction.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int > 0

Help.Tip: Header word for offsets.
Help.Text:
gstk - HDR_OFF
Header word for offsets.
 
 Default = 6
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_OFF for center of first offset bin.
Help.Text:
gstk - OFF_INIT
Value of HDR_OFF for center of first offset bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment between offset bins.
Help.Text:
gstk - OFF_INC
Increment between offset bins.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0

Help.Tip: Width of offset bins.
Help.Text:
gstk - OFF_WID
Width of offset bins.
 
 Default = OFF_INC
 Allowed = OFF_INC >= real > 0.0

Help.Tip: Value of HDR_OFF for center of last offset bin.
Help.Text:
gstk - OFF_LAST
Value of HDR_OFF for center of last offset bin.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real >= OFF_INIT

Help.Tip: Total number of offset bins.
Help.Text:
gstk - OFF_TOT
Total number of offset bins.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int > 0

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
gstk - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
gstk - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
gstk - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
gstk - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
gstk - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
gstk - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
gstk - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
gstk - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
gstk - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
gstk - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
gstk - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : GSTK     (Gatherless STacK)
 Category   : stacks
 Written    : 1986-10-02   by: Mike Howard
 Revised    : 2006-06-20   by: B. Menger
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Stack traces without requirement of sorting into stack gathers.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : NO
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 GSTK sets up a rectangular bin array based on HDR_INL, HDR_CRL and HDR_OFF,
 with the bins occupying memory that is swapped to disk.  Input traces
 assigned to the same bin are stacked together into a single stacked trace.
 Stack scaling is controlled by the TVFSE parameter, which functions the same
 as in STK.
 
 
 2D vs. 3D Operation
 
       For 2D operation and for a 2D line from a 3D survey:
              CRL_TOT should be set to 1, which causes GSTK to ignore the
              crossline direction.
 
       For 3D operation, compositing offsets within GSTK:
              generally INL_TOT > 1, CRL_TOT > 1 and OFF_TOT = 1.
              (set OFF_INIT to 0.0)
 
       For 3D common offset operation:
              generally INL_TOT > 1, CRL_TOT > 1 and OFF_TOT = 1.
              (set OFF_INIT to the nominal offset of the job)
 
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                            ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 
 Memory Allocation
 
 Generally NTIM should be set large enough so that disk swapping is minimized,
 but small enough to control cost and avoid restrictions on memory
 availability.
 
 For operation in conjunction with DMO, NTIM should be set to a minimum
 of the number of bins in a rectangular array that might be populated by a DMO
 broadcast operator for the largest offset within the job.  Larger values may
 increase efficiency, but at some point limits on memory availability and
 memory cost will establish an upper limit on NTIM.
 
 
 Source and Receiver Locations After DMO or Stack
 
 Even though GSTK calculates values for source and receiver surveyed
 coordinate header words, source and receiver locations after DMO or stack are
 not well defined.
 
 If TVFSE paramter is greater than 0.0, the memory or disk size will be
 doubled. For DMO stacking, TVFSE should be 0.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author    Description
     ----        ------    -----------
014. 2006-06-20  B. Menger   Removed Unused Variables.
 13. 2005-10-10  Stoeckley Added missing category STACKS.
 12. 2002-03-07  Chiu      Change the NTIM default from 1 to 5000.
 11. 2001-08-27  Chiu      Add "maxrecords" parameter to temptfile_open
                           to increase the file size if necessary.
 10. 2001-06-18  Chiu      Replace all trcio calls by temptfile calls
                           PRODUCTION.
 9.  2001-05-14  Chiu      Fix frontend problem in pattern_stop2
 8.  2001-03-21  Chiu      Add pc_get_update_state() /= PC_GUI in checking
                           parameters.
 7.  2001-02-14  Chiu      Change wrapped_up to skip_wrapup.
 6.  2000-09-05  Chiu      Conform with stack creteria with front and end mute.
 5.  2000-07-20  Chiu      Use new coordinate for header 7 and 8.
 4.  2000-06-14  Chiu      Add Gui.
 3.  2000-03-21  Chiu      Remove PC_BACKEND check for pc_put_contol.
 2.  2000-01-27  Chiu      header word 32 of filled in traces are set to -1.
 1.  1999-12-07  Chiu      Convert into new CPS.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
